page.title: 05TODDINGTON
page.content: Our square contains the older part of the village of Toddington centred around the church and Toddington Manor. The church of St. Andrew is the third on the site, the earliest dating from the Middle Ages. The present church was built in 1723. The church, Manor and village are connected with the Tracy family, descendants of Edward 11. The Manor is now closed having been used most recently as a school for foreign students. The present Manor is Victorian and is typically ornate. The remains of the original Manor can be seen by the church. Toddington, like most villages in the area, has changed from a farming community to a dormitory village with residents working in nearby towns, notably Cheltenham.
